title: A gap-filling method for room temperature data based on autoencoder neural networks
abstract: This study explores the applicability of a deep learning-based approach for reconstructing missing room temperature data from diﬀerent domains where relatively few training samples are available. For that purpose, the existing convolutional, long short-term memory (LSTM) and feed-forward autoencoders were combined with a suitable domain adaptation procedure. Eventually, the developed models were evaluated on data collected in four buildings with signiﬁ-cant diﬀerences in thermal mass, design and location. The ﬁndings pointed out that the domain adaptation can be conducted eﬃciently by using a small data sample from the target domain. Additionally, the re-sults showed that the proposed model can reconstruct up to 80 % of the missing daily room temperature inputs with RMSE accuracy of 0.6 ° C.
